It amazes me to think that the Philadelphia street urlLink grid was designed in 1680s without any concept of automobile traffic. What was invented as a luxurious way to travel has become a dominant, almost oppressive force in our everyday lives. Commuting through clogged highways just isn't a luxury. Parking lots and garages eat up valuable space and create dead zones of urlLink pigeon poop targets. Then you figure in the gas consumption, pollution, and dirty politics associated with oil dependency. And it is only getting worse. SUVs are the perfect example of advertising misleading you to buy their product even though it costs you 70 bucks to fill the tank, you might rollover on a sharp turn, or kill someone in a smaller car in an accident. I think you're an ass. Sure, I have friends who have SUVs for work, which they need, but soccer moms in the suburbs and pimp daddies cruising South Street bought them because they were told they were urlLink safe and urlLink cool . Guess what they are neither. In fact, in Paris SUVs are being urlLink banned . What business do the Parisians have improving the quality of life for its citizens anyway...maybe they need to start a war?!?
